column4: you could set the dir to rwx--x--x, then other users can access files in the directory (if they have the appropriate permission) but can't get a directory listing (from ls)
and _2 The rest of the files in the -x dir (except the one I explicitly permit with chmod 755 or chmod 777) will not be accessible, right?
any files that are not world readable will not be accessible (wherever they are)...
i suggest you create a directory with mode 711 and put a few files/subdirectories in it and play around....
